p: In conclusion, the molecular interaction between α-syn and PUFA seems to be mediated by two biophysical criteria, of electrostatic and hydrophobic nature. The positively-charged N-terminal domain of α-syn, which is essential for the cooperative formation of helical domains in the protein, is able to recognize the net negative lipid surface charge of PUFA [ 109]. The hydrophobic, fluid lipid core of polyunsaturated acyl chains favors the immersion of the protein into the PUFA layer [ 116].
